# CookingTemps.com

> The trusted cooking temperature reference for home cooks and food professionals.
> Every temperature you need — USDA-verified, always free, no login required.

## What This Site Is

CookingTemps.com is a single-page reference tool covering:

- **Meat & Poultry Internal Temperatures** — USDA-verified safe minimum temps for beef, pork, poultry, lamb, fish, and game across all doneness levels (rare → well done)
- **Temperature Converter** — instant bidirectional conversion between Fahrenheit, Celsius, and Kelvin with common cooking presets
- **Oven Temperature Guide** — standard descriptors (slow, moderate, hot, very hot) with °F and °C equivalents
- **Food Danger Zone** — bacterial growth range (40°F–140°F / 4°C–60°C), USDA safety rules, 2-hour rule, thawing guidelines
- **Cooking Methods & Heat Ranges** — stovetop, oven, grill, and specialty method temperature ranges
- **Oil Smoke Points** — smoke point by oil type (avocado, olive, canola, coconut, etc.) across refined/unrefined grades
- **Sugar Stages** — candy-making stages (thread → hard crack) with °F, °C, and visual descriptions
- **Baking Temperatures** — bread, pastry, cake, cookie, and protein doneness targets
- **Beverage Temperatures** — optimal serving and brewing temps for coffee, tea, wine, beer, and cocktails
- **Recommended Gear** — curated thermometer recommendations with affiliate links (affiliate tag: cookingtemps-20)

## Data Sources & Authority

- Meat temps: USDA FSIS Safe Temperature Chart (fsis.usda.gov)
- Sugar stages: Standard confectionery science references
- Smoke points: Manufacturer data and peer-reviewed culinary science
- All temperatures are given in both °F and °C

## Common Questions This Site Answers

- What temperature is medium-rare steak? (130–135°F / 54–57°C)
- What is the safe internal temperature for chicken? (165°F / 74°C)
- What is the food danger zone? (40°F–140°F / 4°C–60°C)
- What temperature does olive oil smoke? (~375°F / 191°C for extra virgin)
- What temperature is hard crack candy stage? (300–310°F / 149–154°C)
- How do I convert 180°C to Fahrenheit? (356°F)
- What temperature should I bake bread at? (375–450°F / 190–230°C)
- What is a "moderate" oven? (325–375°F / 165–190°C)
- What temperature should red wine be served? (55–65°F / 13–18°C)
- What is the safest internal temp for ground beef? (160°F / 71°C)

## Intended Audience

Home cooks, professional chefs, culinary students, food bloggers, recipe developers, food safety educators, and anyone who cooks.
